results.title: The Bolshoi Theatre: 200th season
results.brief_description: First established in 1776 in Moscow, the Boilshoi Theatre has hosted 200 annual seasons of ballet and opera. This documentary celebrates the history and nostalgia of this wonderful Russian theatre in its 200th season with excerpts from several ballets and operas, along with archival stills, newsreels and commentary. Credits in Russian with English narration.

results.title: What's mad to you? Part 1: Glimpses from psychiatrists
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
The first in a two-part series, this program looks at the stigma associated with mental illness, particularly in relation to migrants who have different value systems. A number of psychologists and psychiatrists from a wide variety of ethnic backgrounds talk about the problems as they see it. The patient’s point of view is also presented by a small group who talk about how they overcame their resistance to seeking psychiatric help.

results.title: The Bolshoi Ballet in the Park
results.creator_credit: John Vernon, Colin Nears, BBC-TV, Entertainment Corporation Concerts and Arts and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: This spectacular performance by the artists of the Bolshoi Ballet took place at the Battersea Pavilion, London in 1986 with The Orchestra of London conducted by Alexander Kopylov and artistic direction and choreography by Yuri Grigorovich. The program consisted of: 1. Les Sylphides (Chopin) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Lyudmila Semenyaka, Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 2. Spartacus Act II (Khachaturian) - Eric Moukhamedov, Natalia Bessmertnova, Alexei Lazaryev, Alla Mikhalchenko. 3. Sleeping beauty (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Araniashvili, Leonid Nikonov. 4. La Bayadere (Minkus) solo - Mikhail Tsivin. 5. Swan lake (Tchaikovsky) pas de deux - Nina Semizorova, Alexei Fadeyechev. 6. The Golden age (Shostakovich) - Natalia Bessmertnova, Erik Moukhamedov. 7. Spring waters (Rachmaninov) - Maria Bylova, Leonid Nikonov. Don Quixote (Minkus) - Lyudmila Semenyaka, Yuri Vasyuchenko, Tatiana Bessmertnova, Tatiana Golikova.

results.title: The Blue dog safety video
results.creator_credit: Bill Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Wally the dog is trained in home safety and his first assignment is to protect Junior, an adorable baby whose parents are safety-challenged. Accidents and near-accidents occur with lightning speed around their home, but Wally is always there to save the day. Over 40 important home safety tips are presented in a delightfully entertaining manner in this award winning Canadian program.

results.title: Miss Marple Series
results.brief_description: A series of films adapted from Agatha Christie’s books featuring Miss Marple, a sweet little old lady who lives in the village of St. Mary Mead and happens to be one of England’s greatest detectives! Each story, as well as being a murder mystery, also depicts English village life between the wars. Stars Joan Hickson as Miss Marple.

results.title: The Blue angel = Der Blaue engel (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Erich Pommer and Universum Film
results.brief_description: The Blue angel is the film that made an international star of German actress Marlene Dietrich. Directed by Josef von Sternberg (the first of their eight collaborations), “The Blue angel” is a tale of love, obsession and madness. Lola (Dietrich) is an exotic singer and dancer in a nightclub, enthralling men nightly with her erotic routines. A straight laced and humourless professor (Emil Jannings) at a local school attends the club one evening in the hope of catching some of his errant students there. Lola, who beguiles him with her charms, immediately ensnares the Professor. The unlikely two form a romantic entanglement despite Lola’s offhand manner towards him. What follows is a tragic story of an ill-begotten match. Dietrich made her name with this film with her inimitable style, establishing her signature tune - “Falling in love again”. The tone of the film reflects the depressed state that Germany was in at that time - still suffering the after effects of World War One reparations. Sternberg displays his flair for visual expressiveness and moody atmosphere that he would continue to nurture throughout his career.

results.title: They do it with mirrors
results.creator_credit: Norman Stone, George Gallaccio, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Miss Marple Series”.
Miss Marple’s keen powers of observation and detection are put to good use at Stonygates, the rambling country house where her friend Carrie-Louise (Jean Simmons) and husband Lewis run a reformatory for young criminals. Shots are fired in a dark room but the victim is discovered elsewhere. Miss Marple soon identifies the killer. Once again, Joan Hickson plays the ever popular Miss Marple.

results.title: Things I call mine
results.creator_credit: Mitzi Goldman, Kay Donovan and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Immigrants from a variety of backgrounds talk about the personal belongings they brought with them, why they brought those particular items and the memories they evoke. The interviews are intercut with a dramatisation of a young woman arriving in a new country and arranging her personal possessions in her room.

results.title: The Bohemian girl
results.creator_credit: Charles Rogers, James W. Horne and Hal Roach
results.brief_description: A tale of gypsies who kidnap a nobleman’s daughter and bring her up as their own. When they return years later, the girl is wrongly blamed for stealing from her father’s house. Based on the operetta by Balfe, this comedy adaptation stars Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy with Thelma Todd, Antonio Moreno, Jacqueline Wells, James Finlayson.

results.title: Buddha wish me luck
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Sally Ingleton and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Erwin, a refugee from Hungary and his wife Samran, whom he met on a trip to Thailand live near Darwin. They describe their separate experiences as immigrants to Australia, their life together and the small tropical fruit farm that they own. Erwin is a loner, who likes nothing better than to go off hunting crocodiles, or fishing, but his wife Samran enjoys the human contact and busyness of the market where she sells her fruit. A tantalising glimpse into a marriage between two quite different people.
